page.title: 13ST SAVIOUR'S HOSPITAL
page.content: St Saviour's hospital is part of the Jersey group of hospitals. The hospital opened in 1868 under the name of the Jersey Lunatic Asylum with just 12 patients. In 1890 a law was introduced providing for certification of patients on admission to the asylum and they remained there until they were discharged or died. During 1891 and 1911 extensions were added to the building and this forms the main part today. In 1952 the name was changed to the Jersey Mental Hospital and in 1963, to try and remove the social stigma attached to mental illness, it was again changed this time to St Saviour's Hospital. Between 1960 and 1980 further buildings were added. Including a new indoor heated pool and a children's unit.
